snippet.title: President Trump was originally cast in 'Sharknado 3'
snippet.content:
Sharknado 3 behind the scenes 3:19
The sharks are back in Sharknado 3, come behind the scenes and meet the stars and see all the action.
July 9th 2015 2 years ago /display/newscorpaustralia.com/Web/NewsNetwork/Entertainment - syndicated/
President Donald Trump almost starred in Sharknado 3. Picture: AP Photo/Evan Vucci
Jessica Sager
Share
DONALD TRUMP was "in serious talks" to play the US President in Sharknado 3: Oh Hell No. After rejected playing the president of the United States in the 2015 film, , 71, almost took the role, in part because of his friendship with the franchise's hero, . Ziering, 53, had previously appeared on . "The Donald said yes," David Latt, co-founder of The Asylum Productions, told in an interview. "He was thrilled to be asked." However, before shooting ever began, Trump's real-life presidential aspirations took precedence over his onscreen leadership.
Ian Ziering goes into battle again in Sharknado 3: Oh Hell No. Picture: Supplied.Source:Supplied Trump's team informed Latt and casting director Gerald Webb that the timing wasn't quite right because Trump was "thinking about making a legitimate run for the presidency ... This might not be the best time." The role, which included a scene where the president shoots sharks that ended up inside the White House before impaling a Great White with an American flag, instead went to one of Trump's biggest television rivals:. The highly-publicised move didn't sit well with the now commander-in-chief's lawyer, Michael D. Cohen, who reportedly called Latt in a fury once the news broke. "He basically said, 'How dare you? Donald wanted to do this. We're going to sue you! We're going to shut the entire show down,'" Latt recalled.
Cohen, however, told THR that he did not recall any "angry correspondence." This article was originally published on
